metadata.title: CVE-2024-39689 on Ubuntu 24.04 LTS (noble) - negligible
metadata.description: Certifi is a curated collection of Root Certificates for validating thetrustworthiness of SSL certificates while verifying the identity of TLShosts. Certifi starting in 2021.05.30 and prior to 2024.07.4 recognizedroot certificates from `GLOBALTRUST`. Certifi 2024.07.04 removes rootcertificates from `GLOBALTRUST` from the root store. These are in theprocess of being removed from Mozilla's trust store. `GLOBALTRUST`'s rootcertificates are being removed pursuant to an investigation whichidentified "long-running and unresolved compliance issues."

criterions.comment: python-certifi: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'see notes').
python-pip: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'see notes').
